name: Zen Inn

reviews.text: If you want a place to stay that is inexpensive, but responsive to the needs of the traveler, this is the place for you. Run by the affable Liam and the lovely Wayan, the Zen Inn offers modest but very honest accommodations attached to a bar/restaurant that serves excellent food at reasonable prices. For residents a basic breakfast is inclusive in the price. And for a pittance more you can eat to your hearts' content in the English tradition of not having to eat again until the "eat-all-you-can" BBQ starts in the early evening (several days a week). Close to some of the best beaches on Bali and a hub for boats to other islands, the Zen Inn rocks. You'll make new friends and have a very good time. Go there.
reviews.title: Great value, attracting a varied and vibrant range of guests . . .

reviews.text: Zen Inn is a great place to stay in PadangBai for several reasons...

reviews.text: - all information available online in English and very quick response to my reservation
reviews.title: Planning my trip back

reviews.text: - local staff is great, very helpful and cheerful
reviews.title: It is like the fictional Cheers, but in Padang Bai

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - the current owner - Liam is a great host, well travelled and knowledgeable of Bali, Indonesia as well as South East Asia. Liam welcomed me upon arrival, provided valuable advice for my travels, recommended further destinations and connections and most of all was a great companion to share a drink with and speak about his rich life adventures. It felt like finding a true friend...
reviews.title: Worst experience in Indonesia

reviews.text: We stayed here 3 nights and absolutely loved it. Padang Bai is a beautiful little place with a few stunning beaches. Both are walking distance from Zen Inn, as well as the town "centre" with its restaraunts and cafes (Go to the Padang Bai Cafe for the best $1 noodles you have ever had!) Staff were very friendly, and so was the resident dog, Jake- he'll walk you to the beach if you like :) The adjoining restaraunt served a great free breakfast of banana pancakes or fruit, and the few other meals we had there were excellent as well. The room was nice with an enclosed opatio area and a shower (indoor and outdoor). My only complaint would be that I think we needed a mosquito net- we got bitten by something at night. Having just arrived though we didnt think to ask for one- I think it should have been in there anyways. But overall I loved my stay there. I even stopped back in while I was staying in Candidasa a few weeks later and took Jake to the beach with me :)
reviews.title: Lovely stay

reviews.text: loved my stay in zen inn, the staff were very friendly and helpful. great location just near the ferry port and within walking distance to the beautiful blue lagoon beach and white sandy beach (absolutely stunning)
reviews.title: great hidden getaway

reviews.text: reasonable prices with breakfast included. excellent place to stay with a retro feel
reviews.title: Hats off to Liam

reviews.text: I stayed at the Zen Inn during my trip to Bali while I did my diving certification, and thoroughly enjoyed myself. Liam is a very gracious host and despite having recently been in a moto-crash, provided me with transport, recommendations, and lots of tips for Padang Bai.
reviews.title: Perfect for a genial host and the port.

reviews.text: The Inn itself is nothing fancy, but it works (though it's probably worth double checking the window coverings to make sure they're airtight). The staff was also very helpful and the food (including nightly barbeques) were great for hanging out/meeting people.
reviews.title: Right at Home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I spent 3 nights in Zen Inn during our time in Padangbai. The hotel cafe / bar is decked out in old Indonesian film posters and overlooks the street. Food is European and moderately priced, the pasta and tomato soup are recommended. Liam, the British owner is very friendly and is full of conversation and friendly advice. The staff are lovely and always eager to help. The rooms are have an old world, lived in ambience and and have outdoor and indoor showers. Breakfast is included, the banana pancake and fruit salads come in massive portions
reviews.title: Friendly owner

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Warangs offering cheap local food are round the corner. Padangbai's harbour where boats depart for neighboring islands is 10 minutes by foot.
reviews.title: Terrible Manager

reviews.text: We took a chance on Zen Inn as it is close to the ferry point as we wanted to travel to the surliest men I have ever had the misfortune to meet. The rooms we're terrible and we could hear the sound of ferries all through the night. Basically I wouldn't stay here if you paid me, its better to go about 100 metres down the road and stop in one of the better establishments.
reviews.title: Lesson learned

reviews.text: I have always had good luck choosing accommodations based on TA reviews, but here I failed to realize that good reviews were only posted by people who had no other postings; anyone who had more than 1 posting was disappointed. As was I. And I also reaslized that it is very likely that a bar/restaurant that has 4 rooms adjacent to it is not apt to provide the best of "hotel" service
reviews.title: Would not recommend

reviews.text: I booked a "standard room" through Hostel World and arrived to find that I had to pay for all three nights up front and that air conditioning was extra (you cannot go without air conditioning in Bali). No matter. I paid the extra $7/night (now up to $28) and it dawned on me over the next three days why I had to pay up front. I imagine that a lot of travelers quickly realize that there are better deals down the street.
reviews.title: Brilliant stay at Zen Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We got very good service from hotel owner - we forgot a dress in the room. The owner arranged it to be transported to us in Kuta so we could pick it up while going to the airport later on our journey. He was very helpful and we did not incur any extra expenses even though they had had the dress cleaned.
reviews.title: Basic accommodation with very good service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were very friendly here and put on a nice breakfast for us. The room was basic but clean however it did not look like the room they have on their website. We liked the cold outdoor shower to refresh ourselves after a hot day and the very hot room - the ceiling fan was not particularly efficient (in our room anyway). The nights were noisy due to a family of cats living above our ceiling and the ferry terminal PA playing music at 5am in the morning. The hotel is well positioned for access to the ferry terminal (right outside) and White Sand Beach which is gorgeous. I was sad not to have met the infamous Liam while we were there for 4 days as he seems to be what gives the place its reputation. Stayed for the BBQ one night which was ok but there are many good restaurants in Padang Bai that are much better value for money. The experience was unfortunately marred a little at the beginning of our holiday when we arrived at the airport in the evening to find the taxi we had arranged to pick us up (arranged by the hotel) no where to be found and had to then look around for someone to take us there at 8pm at night at a higher cost.
reviews.title: Basic accomodation at a good price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 3 days before arrival in the Zen Inn we emailed the owner (liam) that we would arrive one day later than we planned. because of all the nice reviews we read about Liam, we thought that that wouldn't be a problem. Well, what a mistake we made...
reviews.title: Awfull experience!! Don't go there!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The day we arrived Liam was not there and one of the girls checked us in. So far so good. later that day, that same girl went looking for us and told us we had to see Liam. So we did. Without introducing himself, he started shouting at us that he was not pleased with our late arrival and that we had to get the [--] out of his hotel. We were flabbergasted by the way he was treating us. We tried to communicate with him, told him that we emailed him, but he didn't want to listen at all. What a jerk. This is NOT a way to treat guests or any human being.
reviews.title: Just OK - some good and bad

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Gladly a very nice balinese man invited us to stay with him (next to the zen Inn). That night we experienced that the Zen Inn in located opposite of a big truck and busstation. All night long we heard busses and trucks coming and going so we would like to advise to reconsider a stay at Zen Inn if you like a good night sleep!
reviews.title: Ziiiiip into Zen Inn for a Warm Western Welcome !

description: We are a small boutique hotel situated near the ferry port and beaches of a traditional Balinese fishing village. A perfect base for diving, snorkeling or relaxing on the local white sand beach nearby. Each of our comfortable rooms is furnished in a funky, eclectic style. All with double beds, western bathrooms and a private courtyard garden with an additional outside shower. Perfect for stargazing as you shower!
